You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription and an Azure AD tenant named contoso.com.

All users have computers that run Windows 11, are joined to contoso.com, and are protected by using BitLocker Drive Encryption (BitLocker).

You plan to create a user named Admin1 that will perform following tasks:

• View BitLocker recovery keys.
• Configure the usage location for the users in contoso.com.

You need to assign roles to Admin to meet the requirements. The solution must use the principle of least privilege.

Which two roles should you assign? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
- Cloud Device Administrator
- Licence Administrator

comments.content:
Helpdesk Administrator: To view BitLocker recovery keys.(This role was previously named Password Administrator in the Azure portal. It was renamed to Helpdesk Administrator to align with the existing name in the Microsoft Graph API and Microsoft Graph PowerShell)
License Administrator: To configure the usage location for users (instead of User Administrator, as it adheres more closely to the principle of least privilege).

discussion.content:
Answer is correct as Helpdesk Administrator has action of: microsoft.directory/bitlockerKeys/key/read - Read bitlocker metadata and key on devices
and License Administrator has:
microsoft.directory/users/usageLocation/update - Update usage location of users

Given Answer Correct

Helpdesk Administrator:

This role allows Admin1 to view BitLocker recovery keys. According to Microsoft documentation, a help desk technician can use the Microsoft Intune admin center to help an end user get a recovery key for their device1.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/configmgr/tenant-attach/bitlocker-recovery-keys

License admin Assign the License admin role to users who need to assign and remove licenses from users and edit their usage location.

License admins also can:
• Reprocess license assignments for group-based licensing
• Assign product licenses to groups for group-based licensing

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/add-users/about-admin-roles?view=o365-worldwide

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You create a Conditional Access policy that blocks access to an app named App1 when users trigger a high-risk sign-in event.

You need to reduce false positives for impossible travel when the users sign in from the corporate network.

What should you configure?

choices.B: Modify the safe links policy Global settings.
choices.D: Create a new safe links policy.
choices.C: Create a data loss prevention (DLP) policy that has a Content contains condition.
choices.A: Create a data loss prevention (DLP) policy that has a Content is shared condition.

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.
Users in the research department work with sensitive data.
You need to prevent the research department users from accessing potentially unsafe websites by using hyperlinks embedded in email messages and documents. Users in other departments must not be restricted.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Create a new safe links policy.

With this action, you can create a Safe Links policy specifically targeting the users in the research department, ensuring that only they are restricted from accessing potentially unsafe websites through hyperlinks, while other departments remain unaffected.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/office-365-security/set-up-atp-safe-links-policies?view=o365-worldwide

Selected Answer: D
Agree with D
Was in Exam 27-6-24

Selected Answer: D
Copilot says : 

To prevent the research department users from accessing potentially unsafe websites through hyperlinks in email messages and documents, while not restricting other departments, you should:

D. Create a new safe links policy.

Safe Links is a feature in Microsoft Defender for Office 365 that provides URL scanning and time-of-click verification of URLs in email messages, Teams, and supported Office apps1. You can create Safe Links policies that apply to specific users, groups, or domains, which allows you to tailor the protection to the needs of different departments within your organization
